comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66546790@N07] Hmm, IZUMO did not visit Sydney at this time, there were three vessels, IWATE, ASAMA and YAKUMO.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 66546790@N07
comment._content: Maybe this photo is of another Japanese visit. As I know the Izumo visited Australia in 1928.

comment.author: 66546790@N07
comment._content: Why the Izumo? Look at photos of the Iwate of 1920s and you'll see that she didn't have a searchlight top (unfortunately I don't know the correct term in English) on her main-mast while the Izumo did.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66546790@N07] Hmmm, it looks a lot like IZUMO. Thank you for pointing that out Antoine R. The other reason it is most likely IZUMO, is because the previous photograph in the series is this one:
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
